ngiemboon: Ábalam la gwɔ́ tà ńgẅiin ngùʼ ntsɔ̀b lepfwɔʼɔ́ lé móm lepfwɔʼɔ́, Cʉ̀apʉ̀a kẅɛɛ mvfò yé, ńgɔɔn né yé ngie: «Mèŋ n gee Ssé gie e pú ńgẅiin ngʉ̀ʼ. Giŋ páʼ n ne ńkwoŋo, gwɔ́ shwòŋe ńdiŋe.
en: When Abram was ninety-nine years old, the Lord appeared to him, saying, “I am God Almighty.   Live  # 17:1 Or Walk in my presence and be blameless.  # 17:1 Gn 6:9; Ps 15:2; Lk 1:6

ngiemboon: N ge gÿo pɔ̀gɔ gwaa kʉ̀a, é gÿo ngẅɛ̀ jú zyéen tà ńzyéen.»
en: I will set up my covenant between me and you, and I will multiply you greatly.”

ngiemboon: Ábalam júʼ púʼu, ńŋwɔ́ʼ nnɛ́ tà zǐ yé kíbe ssé, Cʉ̀apʉ̀a gɔɔn né yé ngie:
en: Then Abram fell facedown and God spoke with him:

ngiemboon: «Akʉ̀a gie n ge gÿo pɔ̀gɔ gwa, á yɔɔn: ɔ̀ ge gÿo gwɔ́ mángʉanjʉʼ mengwòŋ tà ńgyɔ́ɔn.
en: “As for me, here is my covenant with you: You will become the father of many nations.

ngiemboon: Mé té ge gíŋe tóŋo gú lê Ábalam wɔ́, ɔ̀ cʉ̌ʼ ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ Ábalaham. Mélàʼmie n gÿǒ, ɔ̀ cʉ́ʼʉ mángʉanjʉʼ pʉ̀a mengwòŋ tà ńgyɔ́ɔn.
en: Your name will no longer be Abram;   your name will be Abraham,  # 17:5 = Father of a Multitude for I will make you the father of many nations.  # 17:5 Gn 35:11; 48:19; Rm 4:11–12,16–18

ngiemboon: N ge gÿo gÿo ngẅɛ̀ jù zyéen tà ńzyéen, é gÿo ɔ̀ nuŋe mengwòŋ. Ɔ̀ ge gÿo zyé mefùɔ.
en: I will make you extremely fruitful and will make nations and kings come from you.

ngiemboon: N ge kúʼte kʉ̀a yɔ́gɔ̀, áa kʉ̀a té láʼ ḿmag. Á ge fó na gù, é kúu na ngẅɛ̀ jù mejwoŋó mejwoŋó. À cʉa púʼu, n gwɔ́ Ssé jù. Ńgwɔ́ ye ngẅɛ̀ jù, tà mbɔɔ fʉ̀ʼ gie ɔ̀ te láʼ gíŋe gwɔ́ wó wɔ́.
en: I will confirm my covenant that is between me and you and your future offspring throughout their generations. It is a permanent covenant   to be your God and the God of your offspring after you.  # 17:7 Ex 6:7; Lv 11:45; 26:12,45; Dt 29:13; Heb 11:16; Rv 21:7

ngiemboon: N ge gÿo náa láʼ gie ɔɔ wó, ńgwɔ́ ngʉ̀ lɛ̂ né gù, tà mbɔɔ né ngẅɛ̀ jù gie e ge láʼ tá gwɔ́ wó. Ngwòŋ Kánàhan ntsèm ge láʼa cʉ́ʼʉ gwɔ́ pɔ́ wɔ́b. M biŋ ńgwɔ́ Ssé yɔb.»
en: And to you and your future offspring  ,# 17:8 Gl 3:16 I will give the land where you are residing #— #all the land of Canaan #— #as a permanent possession,  # 17:8 Gn 48:4; Ac 7:5 and I will be their God.”

ngiemboon: E Ssé gíŋe ńgɔɔn né Ábalaham ngie: «Pi ngẅɛ̀ jù na mejwoŋó mejwoŋó giŋ páʼ yɔɔn kʉ̀a né ńzɛ́te, tà mbɔɔ fʉ̀ʼ gie ɔ̀ te láʼ gíŋe gwɔ́ wó wɔ́.
en: God also said to Abraham, “As for you, you and your offspring after you throughout their generations are to keep my covenant.

ngiemboon: Lepʉ̌ sie n zǎb ngie pi ngẅɛ̀ jù giŋ páʼ é ne ńzɛ́te, tà mbɔɔ fʉ̀ʼ gie ɔ̀ te láʼ gíŋe gwɔ́ wó wɔ́, é sɔɔn: pi ge láʼa púʼu púɔ mbàŋa ntsèm tsetsɛ̀ɛ pi.
en: This is my covenant between me and you and your offspring after you, which you are to keep: Every one of your males must be circumcised.

ngiemboon: Lepuʼú jʉʼʉ nnɛ́ ŋwɛ́ ge láʼa gwɔ́ liŋé kʉ̀a gie áa tsetsɛ̀ɛ pege.
en: You must circumcise the flesh of your foreskin to serve as a sign of the covenant between me and you.  ,# 17:11 Ex 12:48; Dt 10:16; Ac 7:8; Rm 4:11

ngiemboon: Mé ge láʼa zyé múɔ mbàŋa na ngẅɛ̀ gi mejwoŋó mejwoŋó, e cʉa lyɛ̌ʼ lefɔ̌ɔn léfó lyɛʼɛ́ nzyé, mé púʼu yé. À kwoŋ á gwɔ́ zyé gẅi, ńkwoŋ á gwɔ́ zyé nyìŋ gẅie mé la lɔg nkáb ńjúu yé mbwó nyìŋe túm gẅie à te na ngẅɛ̀ gi wɔ́.
en: Throughout your generations, every male among you is to be circumcised   at eight days old #— #every male born in your household or purchased from any foreigner and not your offspring.

ngiemboon: Púʼu la, mé ge láʼa púʼu múɔ mbàŋa gẅie à kẅɛɛ na ngẅɛ̀ gi, mbɔɔ gẅie mé lɔ̌g nkáb jù, ńjú. Akʉ̀a yɔ́ɔn gie áa na mbab nnɛ́ gi, aa kʉ̀a temàg.
en: Whether born in your household or purchased, he must be circumcised. My covenant will be marked in your flesh as a permanent covenant.

ngiemboon: Ńgʉa na mámbàŋa gẅie mé kaa púʼu yé wɔ́, mé fó nùɔ pʉ̀a láʼ ńjwoŋo yé. Ńtí nue à zyɛʼɛ́ kʉ̀a yɔ́ɔn.»
en: If any male is not circumcised in the flesh of his foreskin, that man will be cut off from his people; he has broken my covenant.”

ngiemboon: E Ssé gíŋe ńgɔɔn né Ábalaham ngie: «Te gíŋe ńtóŋo nzwě gù lê Salayi, mé ge cʉ́ʼʉ tóŋo yé pɔ́ lê Sǎlà.
en: God said to Abraham, “As for your wife Sarai, do not call her Sarai, for Sarah   will be her name.

ngiemboon: N ge cÿɔʼɔ Sǎlà, pi yé zyé múɔ mbàŋa; é cÿɔʼɔ yé púʼu, à gÿo ńgwɔ́ mángʉanjʉʼ mengwòŋo mengwòŋ; Mefùɔ meláʼa meláʼ piŋ ńdáʼ kẅɛɛ na ngẅɛ̀ ye.»
en: I will bless her; indeed, I will give you a son by her.   I will bless her, and she will produce nations; kings of peoples will come from her.”

ngiemboon: Ábalaham júʼ púʼu, ńŋwɔ́ʼ nnɛ́ tà zǐ yé kíbe ssé, tá ńgẅe, ńtí nue à la ne ńkwaŋte tsɛ̀ɛ ntʉ́m yé ngie: «Mèŋ gẅie n gẅǐin ngùʼ nkÿo, ngwɔ́ á cʉa lêkɔ́ tà mèŋ n gíŋe ńzyé? Ngwɔ́ Sǎlà gẅie à gẅiin ngùʼ móm lepfwɔʼɔ́ gíŋe ńzyé múɔ lá?»
en: Abraham fell facedown. Then he laughed   and said to himself, “Can a child be born to a hundred-year-old man? Can Sarah, a ninety-year-old woman, give birth? ”

ngiemboon: Ábalaham gɔɔn né Ssé ngie: «Anò gwɔ́ pɔ́ ngie ɔ̀ pɔ́ɔnte Esemayɛ̂ɛ, à gwɔ́ wó!»
en: So Abraham said to God, “If only Ishmael were acceptable   to you! ”

ngiemboon: E Ssé gɔɔn ngie: «Ngǎŋ, á té púʼu wɔ́, pi nzwě gù Sǎlà ge gÿo zyé tàʼ múɔ mbàŋa. Ɔ̀ tsẅi lezíŋ sé lê Ésàg. N ge gÿo gÿo akʉ̀a yɔ́ɔn gie áa kʉ̀a temàg, à gwɔ́ yé, ńgwɔ́ ye ngẅɛ̀ yé; tà mbɔɔ fʉ̀ʼ gie à te láʼ gíŋe gwɔ́ wó wɔ́.»
en: But God said, “No. Your wife Sarah will bear you a son, and you will name him Isaac.   I will confirm my covenant with him as a permanent covenant for his future offspring.

ngiemboon: Ńgʉa na Esemayɛ̂ɛ, mbà mèŋ n jǔʼ. N ge cÿɔʼɔ yé, é gÿo à gẅiin gubé tɛʼ, é gÿo ngẅɛ̀ ye zyéen tà ńzyéen. À ge láʼ zyé púɔ ntɔ́ʼ ntsɔ̀b pʉ́a. É piŋ nuŋe máamáa ngwòŋ.
en: As for Ishmael, I have heard you. I will certainly bless him; I will make him fruitful and will multiply him greatly. He will father twelve tribal leaders,   and I will make him into a great nation.

ngiemboon: Táʼ, ńgʉa na kʉ̀a yɔ́ɔn, mbà peg Ésàg ge gwa, aa múɔ gẅie pi Sǎlà ge zyé fʉ̀ʼ páʼɔɔn, á ntyě fʉ̀ʼɔɔn.
en: But I will confirm my covenant with Isaac, whom Sarah will bear to you at this time next year.”

ngiemboon: E Ssé pɔ́ Ábalaham la shwóŋo tà ńtsẅé jʉʼ, e Ssé nyé Ábalaham, ńkwɔ́ʼ né tÿǒ.
en: When he finished talking with him, God withdrew   from Abraham.  # 17:22 Gn 35:13

ngiemboon: Kwàʼ lyɛ̌ʼ ŋwɛ́ gie Ssé la gɔɔn, Ábalaham pú ḿbúʼ mbàŋa ntsèm gie é laa ndá yé: á míŋ we Esemayɛ̂ɛ, é mbàŋa ntsèm gie mé la zyé ndá yé, tà mbɔɔ menkwɔɔn pie à la lɔg nkáb ńjú.
en: So Abraham took his son Ishmael and those born in his household or purchased #— #every male among the members of Abraham’s household #— #and he circumcised the flesh of their foreskin on that very day, just as God had said to him.

ngiemboon: Mé la gwaa púʼu Ábalaham mbà à gẅǐin ngùʼ ntsɔ̀b lepfwɔʼɔ́ lé móm lepfwɔʼɔ́.
en: Abraham was ninety-nine years old when the flesh of his foreskin was circumcised,

ngiemboon: Ńgwaa púʼu Esemayɛ̂ɛ á gẅiin ngùʼ ntsɔ̀b tá lé legém.
en: and his son Ishmael was thirteen years old when the flesh of his foreskin was circumcised.

ngiemboon: Mé la pú ḿbúʼu wɔ́b pɔ́ tàʼa lyɛ̌ʼ.
en: On that very day Abraham and his son Ishmael were circumcised.

ngiemboon: Ńgwaa púʼu wɔ́b púʼu, ńgíŋe ḿbúʼ mbàŋa ntsèm gie é laa ndá Ábalaham, pâ menkwɔɔn pie mé la zyé ndá yé, tà mbɔɔ menkwɔɔn pie mé la júu mbwó megʉ̀.
en: And all the men of his household #— #whether born in his household or purchased from a foreigner #— #were circumcised with him.
